an6.48:1: Then a certain brahmin approached the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him. When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side and said to the Blessed One:
an6.48:2: "Well then, brahmin, I will question you in turn about this. Answer as you see fit. What do you think, brahmin? (1) When there is lust within you, do you know: ‘There is lust within me,’ and when there is no lust within you, do you know: ‘There is no lust within me’?"
an6.48:3: "What do you think, brahmin? (2) When there is hatred within you … () … delusion within you … (4) … a bodily fault within you[n.150]Kāyasandosaṁ, followed byvacīsandosaṁandmanosandosaṁ.Mpglosses the first as a faulty quality in the body-door(kāyadvārassa dussanākāraṁ).… (5) … a verbal fault within you … (6) … a mental fault within you, do you know: ‘There is a mental fault within me,’ and when there is no mental fault within you, do you know: ‘There is no mental fault within me’?"
an6.48:4: "Excellent, Master Gotama! … Let Master Gotama consider me a lay follower who from today has gone for refuge for life."
